questiontext.text:
Consider a Cantilever beam as shown in the image above.

The wall generates a reaction force, R, at positon A (x=0) and an anticlockwise moment, M.

The beam itself has a weight of 1.5kN per m.

Using the convention that upward forces and anti-clockwise moments are positive, and the information given:

a) Calculate the magnitude of the reaction force R and the moment M to the nearest whole number.

R = {1:NUMERICAL:=3790:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

M = {1:NUMERICAL:=3630:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

b) Calculate and draw the Shear Force Diagram (SFD) on paper and identify the following values:

Shear Force just to the right of A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=3790:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=2910:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of C.

{1:NUMERICAL:=1840:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of D.

{1:NUMERICAL:=1240:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of E.

{1:NUMERICAL:=720:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of F.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the SFD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A combination of a slope and a straight line.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~=A line with a slope.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A combination of a slope and a straight line.~A curve}

4) D and E {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~=A combination of a slope and a straight line.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

5) E and F {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

c) Calculate and draw the Bending Moment Diagram (BMD) on paper and identify the following values:

Bending moment at A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-3630:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-1922:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at C.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-972:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at D.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-356:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at E.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-144:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at F.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the BMD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

4) D and E {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

5) E and F {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

generalfeedback.text:
Your Shear Force Diagram should look like the image shown above.

Note that the portions that would usually be horizontal are now sloped as we have taken the weight of the beam into account.

However, the slope is negligible,so the weight of the beam is usually ignored.

Your Bending Moment Diagram is the integral of the SFD

Note that the portions that would usually be horizontal are now sloped as we have taken the weight of the beam into account.

However, the slope is negligible,so the weight of the beam is usually ignored.

Your Bending Moment Diagram is the integral of the SFD

questiontext.text:
Consider a Cantilever beam as shown in the image above.

The wall generates a reaction force, R, at positon A (x=0) and an anticlockwise moment, M.

The beam itself has a weight of 1.5kN per m.

Using the convention that upward forces and anti-clockwise moments are positive, and the information given:

a) Calculate the magnitude of the reaction force R and the moment M to the nearest whole number.

R = {1:NUMERICAL:=3100:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

M = {1:NUMERICAL:=2286:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

b) Calculate and draw the Shear Force Diagram (SFD) on paper and identify the following values:

Shear Force just to the right of A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=3100:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=2690:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of C.

{1:NUMERICAL:=1770:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of D.

{1:NUMERICAL:=1620:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of E.

{1:NUMERICAL:=1013:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of F.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the SFD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A combination of a slope and a straight line.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~=A line with a slope.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A combination of a slope and a straight line.~A curve}

4) D and E {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~=A combination of a slope and a straight line.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

5) E and F {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

c) Calculate and draw the Bending Moment Diagram (BMD) on paper and identify the following values:

Bending moment at A.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-2286:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at B.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-1696:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at C.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-804:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at D.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-635:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at E.

{1:NUMERICAL:=-270:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at F.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the BMD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

4) D and E {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

5) E and F {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}
